org.tantalum.net

Class StaticWebCache.GetWebTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tantalum.Task
      • org.tantalum.net.StaticWebCache.GetWebTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    StaticWebCache

    public final class StaticWebCache.GetWebTask
extends Task
    This Task performs a StaticWebCache.GET_WEB operation on a Worker thread in the background. For convenience, you normally call StaticWebCache.getAsync(String url, int priority, int getType, Task task) where getType is StaticWebCache.GET_WEB and task is some operation you supply which you would like to act on the result of the getAsync(). You can, if you prefer, invoke this class directly to tailor how it operates or set parameters. The pattern for synchronous use when on a background Worker thread is: 
    
 Object out = new GetWebTask(url).get();
    The pattern for asynchronous use from the UI thread is: 
    
 UITask uiTask = new UITask() {
    protected Object exec(final Object in) {
       Object out = in;
       // Do something on the Worker thread with the fetched data
       return out;
    }

    protected void onCanceled() {
        // Do something on the UI thread if the Task is cancel()ed or there is an error (usually HTTP error)
    }

    protected void onPostExecute(Object result) {
       // Do something on the UI Thread with the result from exec() above
    }
 };

 Task getTask = new GetWebTask(String url);
 getTask.chain(uiTask);
 getTask.fork();

    • Constructor Detail

      • StaticWebCache.GetWebTask

        public StaticWebCache.GetWebTask(byte[] postMessage)
        Create a StaticWebCache.GET_WEB actor which will execute on the Worker thread using as input the chained output from a previous Task. For most purposes, it is easier to use the convenience method StaticWebCache.getAsync() to chain your Task after the getAsync operation before fork()ing the Task for background execution.
        Parameters:
        postMessage -

      • StaticWebCache.GetWebTask

        public StaticWebCache.GetWebTask(java.lang.String key,
                         byte[] postMessage)
        Create a StaticWebCache.GET_WEB actor which will execute on the Worker thread. This already knows the URL, so does not need to be chain()ed to another Task to operate properly. For most purposes, it is easier to use the convenience method StaticWebCache.getAsync() to chain your Task after the getAsync operation before fork()ing the Task for background execution.
        Parameters:
        key -
        postMessage -
